snippet: SCEcorp, parent of the Southern California Edison Company, said a proposed decision by the California Public Utilities Commission might make it impossible to proceed with its $2.90 billion merger offer for the San Diego Gas and Electric Company.  ...
lead_paragraph: SCEcorp, parent of the Southern California Edison Company, said a proposed decision by the California Public Utilities Commission might make it impossible to proceed with its $2.90 billion merger offer for the San Diego Gas and Electric Company. The proposed merger of the two California companies would create the nation's largest investor-owned electrical utility.
